result.markdown:
---
title: "Teste T (Dependentes e Pareadas)"
author: "Yuri"
format: html

execute: 
  freeze: auto
  cache: true
  warning: false
---


Selencionando pacote:


::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_fbdac556dd561890e17ba8b1fcf3c5a9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(magrittr) # para usar pipes
library(ggplot2) # para gráficos
library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
library(tidyr)
```
:::


Conjunto de dados:


::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_ba747d64331b7f80167f66797bd8be2c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
data_mg <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx")
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_54158c29df8daf0fca17ddbd1587ff94'}

```{.r .cell-code}
 # paramétrico
dat2 <- data_mg |> 
  group_by(trat) |> 
  summarise(mean_comp = mean(comp),
    sd_comp = sd(comp),var_comp = var(comp), n = n(),
    se_comp = sd_comp / sqrt(n - 1),
    ci = se_comp * qt(0.025, df = 9))
dat2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 7
  trat    mean_comp sd_comp var_comp     n se_comp     ci
  <chr>       <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl> <int>   <dbl>  <dbl>
1 Mg2          10.5    1.54     2.39    10   0.515 -1.16 
2 control      15.7    1.27     1.61    10   0.424 -0.958
```
:::
:::


Gráficos:


::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_a0f0d89ecabf74f63d28297b9a8848db'}

```{.r .cell-code}
dat2 |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, mean_comp))+
  geom_col(width = 0.5,
           fill = "steelblue")+
  geom_errorbar(aes(
    ymin = mean_comp - ci,
    ymax = mean_comp + ci
  ),
  width = 0.05
  )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula9_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Estatística

Teste T:


::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_89d8ab83624590743cc5cb9aa2059bf9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
data_mg2 <- data_mg |> 
  pivot_wider(1, names_from = trat, values_from = comp)
data_mg2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
     rep   Mg2 control
   <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
 1     1   9      13.7
 2     2  12.5    15.9
 3     3  10      15.7
 4     4   8      14.2
 5     5  13.2    15.9
 6     6  11      16.5
 7     7  10.8    18  
 8     8   9.5    14.4
 9     9  10.8    16.4
10    10  10.4    16  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
t.test(data_mg2$Mg2, data_mg2$control, paired = F)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Welch Two Sample t-test

data:  data_mg2$Mg2 and data_mg2$control
t = -8.1549, df = 17.354, p-value = 2.423e-07
alternative hypothesis: true difference in means is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -6.490393 -3.825607
sample estimates:
mean of x mean of y 
   10.520    15.678 
```
:::
:::


Teste de variâncias homegênias:


::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_5d98f492aa366a68cc7f191b2bb0f341'}

```{.r .cell-code}
attach(data_mg2)
var.test(Mg2, control)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  Mg2 and control
F = 1.4781, num df = 9, denom df = 9, p-value = 0.5698
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.3671417 5.9508644
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
          1.478111 
```
:::
:::


Shapiro (normalidade):


::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_46de4201bc6c31596f6f71c30c5730cd'}

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  Mg2
W = 0.97269, p-value = 0.9146
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(control)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  control
W = 0.93886, p-value = 0.5404
```
:::
:::


Análise visual da premissa de normalidade:


::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_7542cfacc3b7c2cebf82fd8d1a91d162'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(Mg2)
qqline(Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula9_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(control)
qqline(control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula9_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_199694ce69ccac2b8a2dd676db730d88'}

```{.r .cell-code}
escala <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx", "escala")
head(escala)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 7
  assessment rater acuracia precisao vies_geral vies_sistematico vies_constante
  <chr>      <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl>      <dbl>            <dbl>          <dbl>
1 Unaided    A        0.809    0.826      0.979            1.19         0.112  
2 Unaided    B        0.722    0.728      0.991            0.922       -0.106  
3 Unaided    C        0.560    0.715      0.783            1.16         0.730  
4 Unaided    D        0.818    0.819      0.999            0.948       -0.00569
5 Unaided    E        0.748    0.753      0.993            1.10         0.0719 
6 Unaided    F        0.695    0.751      0.925            0.802        0.336  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
escala2 <- escala |> 
  select(assessment, rater, acuracia)
escala2|> 
  pivot_wider(1, 
              names_from = assessment,
              values_from = acuracia)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
   rater Unaided Aided1
   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>
 1 A       0.809  0.907
 2 B       0.722  0.913
 3 C       0.560  0.915
 4 D       0.818  0.960
 5 E       0.748  0.959
 6 F       0.695  0.903
 7 G       0.807  0.851
 8 H       0.781  0.880
 9 I       0.776  0.950
10 J       0.618  0.944
```
:::
:::


##### Teste T


::: {.cell hash='aula9_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_cc8ae8d3d85a477cfe3edd8414060664'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#attach(escala2)
#t_escala <- t.test(Aided1, Unaided,paired = TRUE,
#var.equal = FALSE) # Resultado: há efeito da escala

#var.test(Aided1,Unaided) # Homocedasticidade
#shapiro.test(Aided1) # Normalidade. p-value maior que 0,05, então não rejeita H0, logo os valores são homogeneos. 
#shapiro.test(Unaided) # p-value maior que 0,05, então não rejeita H0, logo os valores são homogeneos.
#library(report)
#report(t_escala)
#wilcox.test(Aided1, Unaided) # Teste não paramétrico equivalente ao teste t pareado. Utilizar esse teste se houvesse problemas com a normalidade e homocedaticidade.

#escala |> 
#ggplot(aes(assessment, precisao)) +
#geom_boxplot(outlier.color = NA)
```
:::


wilcoxteste é o teste nao parametico equivalente ao teste -t parametrico.
